bug.author: clippered
bug.summary: Tokenization of URLs is different between English language model 2.2.0 and 2.2.5
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>How to reproduce the behaviour</denchmark-h>
Hi, There was a change in tokenizing URLs between sPacy language model en_core_web_sm 2.2.0 and 2.2.5 This code: <denchmark-code>import spacy nlp = spacy.load('en_core_web_sm') doc = nlp('the url is https://www.example.com.ai/foo/bar/) for t in doc: print(t.lower_) </denchmark-code>
Using en_core_web_sm 2.2.0, the output is: <denchmark-code>the url is https://www.example.com.ai/foo/bar/ </denchmark-code>
Using en_core_web_sm 2.2.5, the output is: <denchmark-code>the url is https://www.example.com.ai / foo / bar/ </denchmark-code>
But the weird thing is when using just https://www.example.com/foo/bar/ without .ai in domain, the output is the same for both model versions <denchmark-code>the url is https://www.example.com/foo/bar/ </denchmark-code>
Any ideas? Thanks. <denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
Operating System: macOS Catalina 10.15.2 Python Version Used: 3.7.6 spaCy Version Used: 2.2.3 Environment Information: Language model en_core_web_sm 2.2.0 and 2.2.5

comments.comment: Thanks for the report! It looks like one of the changes in I made in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/pull/4374>#4374</denchmark-link> (in v2.2.2+) broke the pattern for host names with more than a simple format.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
